task.name: Import_from_ElasticSearch
task.description: Load data from Elasticsearch. The task requires the following third-party credentials : ELASTICSEARCH_USERNAME and ELASTICSEARCH_PASSWORD. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. It also requires a QUERY and an INDEX to fetch data. By default, it will fetch all documents from the specified index. The imported data is exported in a JSON format.

def connect(host, port, username, password): """ A util for making a connection to elasticsearch """
# Connect to cluster over SSL using auth for best security: es_header = [{ 'host': host, 'port': port, 'use_ssl': True, 'http_auth': (username,password) }]
# Instantiate the new Elasticsearch connection: es = Elasticsearch(es_header)
return es
def read_elasticsearch(index, query, search_size, host, port, username, password):
# Connect to elasticsearch es = connect(host=host, port=port, username=username, password=password)
# Make a query to the specific DB and Collection res = es.search(index=index, size=search_size, body=query) print("%d documents found" % res['hits']['total'])
return res

task.name: Export_to_ElasticSearch
task.description: This task allows exporting data to ElasticSearch. The task requires the following third-party credentials : ELASTICSEARCH_USERNAME and ELASTICSEARCH_PASSWORD. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. It requires the following variables: $ELASTICSEARCH_INDEX: the index to use. It is created if it does not exist $ELASTICSEARCH_DOC_TYPE: the documents type. $ELASTICSEARCH_INPUT: A JSON Object/Array to be indexed in ElasticSearch. This variable can: - A String describing the JSON Object/Array - A relative path in the data space of a JSON file.
